sentence.Network_en: Wells was well aware of the precariousness of human life.
sentence.Network_cn: 韦尔斯深知人类生活的不稳定性。

sentence.Network_en: The precariousness is further increased by self - experiences in the aforementioned marginal situation.
sentence.Network_cn: 在上述边际情况下自身经验会更进一步增加这种不确定感.

sentence.Network_en: These reports have revealed to the insurgents the precariousness of their position.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些报导使叛乱士兵知道了他们的危险境地.

PerfectNetExp.abs: precarburization 预先碳化precariousness 不稳定；不安全；危险；根据不充分precast concrete 预制混凝土
precarburization 预先碳化precariousness 不稳定；不安全；危险；根据不充分precast concrete 预制混凝土
(fragmentary answer),这种回答也是不稳定的(precarious),就如同艺术伦理所附着的对象那样;还有,不稳定(precariousness)构成了今日艺术伦理的主导性特点和拉康意义上的.

list.abs: 晃晃(perched precariously), 此释义来源于网络辞典。
... 爱之如命 inordinately fond of sth 不绝如缕 almost extinct;hanging by a thread;very precarious 定题情报提供 sdi.
he was unable to get down from his precarious position on the rocks ., 他无法从岩石危险的位置上下来.

the Bucks found themselves in a precarious situation after their first six games , Sporting a 2-4 record after two humbling road losses to the Houston Rockets and the San Antonio Spurs .六场比赛之后，现在雄鹿的处于一种不稳定状态，留下2胜4负的记录，其中包括2场输给火箭和马刺，这是2场耻辱的失利。

entry.tran: （局势）不确定的，不稳定的，危险的
entry.def: If your situation is precarious, you are not in complete control of events and might fail in what you are doing at any moment.

example.ex: Our financial situation had become precarious.
example.tran: 我们的财务状况已变得不稳定了。

entry.def: Something that is precarious is not securely held in place and seems likely to fall or collapse at any moment.

example.ex: They looked rather comical as they crawled up precarious ladders.
example.tran: 他们顺着摇摇晃晃的梯子往上爬，看起来非常滑稽。

auth_sentence.content: Whitney, whose father served five tours of duty in Iraq, knows the precariousness of war.
auth_sentence.res_content: Whitney, whose father served five tours of duty in Iraq, knows the precariousness of war.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whitney, whose father served five tours of duty in Iraq, knows the precariousness of war.
